0: Former President George H.W. Bush has been released from a Texas hospital seven days after being admitted for having trouble breathing. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He is now resting at home, grateful to the doctors and nurses for their superb care," his spokesman Jim McGrath said in a statement this afternoon. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The 90-year-old former president was rushed to Houston's Methodist Hospital on Dec. 23 after experiencing a shortness of breath earlier that evening. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He was kept in the facility through Christmas though his spokesman regularly reported that he was in good spirits and the additional observation periods were done out of an abundance of caution. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Bush's most recent public appearance came in November when he attended an event at Texas A&M; University with his son, fellow former President George W. Bush. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The elder President Bush was diagnosed with a thyroid condition called Graves Disease during his presidency when he was hospitalized for an irregular heartbeat.
